greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, A094457(n)).
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{g, h}, g[x_] := Flatten[Table[#1, {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ x]; h[x_] := If[x == 2, 1, NextPrime[x, -1]]; If[n == 1, 1, Max[Times @@ MapAt[h, g[n], #] & /@ Range[Length@ g[n]]]]]; Table[GCD[i, f@ i], {i, 2, 74}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 31 2015 *)
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, May 06 2004
